title: 81/647/ECSC: Commission Decision of 10 July 1981 approving aids from the Kingdom of Belgium to the coal-mining industry during 1980 (Only the French and Dutch texts are authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 10 July 1981 approving aids from the Kingdom of Belgium to the coal-mining industry during 1980 (Only the Dutch and French texts are authentic) (81/647/ECSC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The Kingdom of Belgium is hereby authorized in respect of the 1980 calendar year to grant aid totalling Bfrs 5 437 200 000 to the Belgian coal-mining industry.
The amount of Bfrs 5 437 200 000 provided in respect of the calendar year 1979 is divided as follows:    1. grant of investment aid of Bfrs 450 000 000 apportioned between the two coalfields as follows:      - to the Campine coalfield an amount not exceeding Bfrs 449 800 000,
- to the Southern coalfield an amount not exceeding Bfrs 200 000;
2. grant of aid to cover losses of Bfrs 4 987 200 000 apportioned between the two coalfields as follows:      - to the Campine coalfield an amount not exceeding Bfrs 4 029 600 000,
- to the Southern coalfield an amount not exceeding Bfrs 957 600 000.

The Government of the Kingdom of Belgium shall notify the Commission by 31 October 1981 of details of the aids granted pursuant to this Decision and in particular of the amount of the payments made and the manner in which they are apportioned.
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Belgium.
